title: Albanian language
summary: Albanian (endonym: shqip [ʃcip] or gjuha shqipe [ˈɟuha ˈʃcipɛ]) is an Indo-European language spoken by the Albanians in the Balkans and the Albanian diaspora in the Americas, Europe and Oceania.[1][9] With about 7.5 million speakers,[1][2] it comprises an independent branch within the Indo-European languages and is not closely related to any other Indo-European language.[10]
